data.title: Scholarships
data.meta_description: Rowan University is a Carnegie-classified national doctoral research institution dedicated to excellence in undergraduate and graduate education.
data.text:
A list of scholarships is given below. Rowan students have won many of these. Information changes periodically, so check the list frequently.

New Jersey Water Environment Association

Daniel Bigler Scholarship - 1 award of $1,850, open to undergraduates. Louis Fontenelli Scholarship, 1 award of $1,750, open to graduate students. Coordinate with Dr. Jahan.

New Jersey Section, American Water Works Association

Drinking Water Career Scholarship - 1 of $1,500, May application deadline. Open to seniors and graduate students. Coordinate with Dr. Jahan.

New Jersey Association of Conservation Districts

Memorial Conservation Scholarship - up to 2 of $1,000, October application deadline. Open to New Jersey residents studying in conservation related field, including environmental engineering. Coordinate with Dr. Everett.

American Council of Engineering Companies

ACEC Scholarship - up to 5 of $1-2,000, December application deadline. Open to all students who will be juniors or seniors in Fall 05. Rowan students have a very good chance at this scholarship. Coordinate with Dr. Cleary.

Women's Transportation Seminar, Philadelphia Chapter

Suzanne Axworthy Undergraduate Scholarship - 1 award of $1,000, November application deadline. Open to women with a GPA of 3.0 or higher who plan to pursue a career in transportation. Also - Carmen E. Turner Graduate Scholarship. Coordinate with Dr. Sukumaran.

Construction Industry Advancement Program of NJ

Audrey Frapaul & Edward O. Davis Memorial Student Summer Employment Scholarship Program –1 award of $5,000, 11 awards of $3,500, 15 of $2,500 (Franklyn Grosso stipend), November application deadline. Current sophomores and juniors, must be employed during the summer by a New Jersey Construction Contractor. Coordinate with Dr. Douglas Cleary.

American Society of Civil Engineers

Samuel Fletcher Tapman Scholarship, ~12 at $2,000, February application deadline. Any year, ASCE student member, money must be used to continue undergraduate education. We can only forward one student from Rowan. We’ve won a bunch of these! See website for more information. Coordinate with Dr. Cleary. -last updated 9/14/06

Freeman Fellowship, $2,000-$5,000, February application deadline. Grant for expenses for experiments, observations, and compilations to discover new and accurate data useful in engineering, emphasis on hydraulic science and art. See website for more information. Coordinate with professor who would supervise your activities. -last updated 9/14/06

Daniel W. Mead Contest, 1st place $1000, 2nd $800, 3rd $600, 4th $400, 5th $200, paper may be published in Civil Engineering Magazine, March application deadline. ASCE student member, no more than 2000 word paper on specific topic (see website for topic). See website for more information. Coordinate with professor whose expertise best matches the paper topic. -last updated 9/14/06

Construction Engineering Scholarship and Student Prize, 1 of $?, April application deadline. ASCE student member, money must be used to continue undergraduate education, student must intend to seek employment in the construction industry. See website for more information. Coordinate with Dr. Cleary. -last updated 9/14/06

And there are more listed. Check them out!

American Society of Civil Engineers, New Jersey Section

Section Student Scholarship, multiple at $2,000, April application deadline. Current Junior, ASCE student member, money must be used to continue undergraduate education. See website for more information.

Association of State Dam Safety Officials

Dam Safety Scholarship Program, multiple at up to $5,000, March application deadline. Senior standing next year, U.S. citizen, 2.5 GPA or better, recommendation of advisor, and essay. See website for more information.

National Society of Professional Engineers

Information and application instructions for multiple scholarships are available on the NSPE web by following the student information link.

Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship

Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship, $7,500, February application deadline. Current Junior or Senior in Math, Natural Science, or Engineering with GPA 3.0 or higher.

American Society of Highway Engineers

William Reeves Memorial Scholarship, multiple at $2,500, March application deadline. Sophomore, Junior, or Senior standing, resident of Atlantic, Burlington, Cumberland, Camden, Cape May, Gloucester, Mercer, Ocean, or Salem Counties.
